pr_title: KOGITO-862: Adding bridge to new resource content get method with Options

timeline.message: KOGITO-862: Adding bridge to new resource content get method with Options

timeline.bodyText: hey @jesuino - not sure if makes sense here, but could the value for the type be something more spec-like? I understand calling the resource API, by using whatever options, will finally produce an HTTP request, so maybe can we document properly, in the JavaDocs, and also consider the value for the type, for example, as a valid MIME types?

replies.bodyText:
Hello @romartin , thanks for the feedback.
The calls to the resourceContent API are not actually HTTP requests. They use the envelope API to exchange messages with the channel.
A call to get a resource fire an async message to retrieve a certain resource content, captured by the envelope messaging API. Later the channel respond with the resource content, so the API finds the original callback to get the resource and call it with the resource content.
If you want a binary resource, for example, we will encode it using base64 because "Base64 is particularly prevalent on the World Wide Web[1] where its uses include the ability to embed image files or other binary assets inside textual assets such as HTML and CSS files."[1]
Please let me know your thoughts.
Thanks!
[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64
